PortabilityKnowhow.PortabilityKnowhowTitle: Online Quick User Manual - Knowledge-Based Search

ns2:section.ns2:para: This manual provides a brief description of procedures from installation through to use of the Knowledge-Based Search.

Operating as an Eclipse plug-in, this tool makes a rough estimate of the scale of rewriting required of programmers in migrating to JBoss. It comes with the following major features.
Major tool features
Feature Description
Search function Feature for finding code that must be rewritten in porting software to JBoss.
Feature for editing search results Enables editing of a visual representation of search results. It allows you to individually adjust the need for porting of search results. This improves the accuracy in extracting the scale of porting based on the requirements of each application.
Conversion function Finds and converts code that can be converted.
It has been confirmed that the tool can operate in the following hardware environment.

ns2:row.ns2:entry: Pentium (R) Dual-Core CPU E5400 @2.70GHz (2 CPU) or the equivalent

ns2:section.ns2:para: It has been confirmed that the tool can operate in the following software environment.

ns2:note.ns2:para: When Python and lxml module are not installed, please install it with reference to Appendix "Installing Python and lxml module".

ns2:section.ns2:para: This tool assumes that the following file is present.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: A Knowledge XML file created by the Knowledge Manager

ns2:section.ns2:para: Set up the operating environment described above. Perform the steps below after the required environment has been set up.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para:
Unzip the downloaded file. Unzipping the file creates the tubame.portability_* directory.
The * part of the name varies with the version.
Unzipping the file in Windows may fail due to path length limitations. If it fails, use a short path such as C:\temp for unzipping.

Use a text editor to open resources/properties/application*.properties under the unzipped directory. As shown below, set the path where Python is installed.
# Example showing installation under Windows PYTHON_RUNTIME_PATH=C:/Python27/python.exe
Move or copy the unzipped directory to the plugins directory under the Eclipse installation directory.
Select the Eclipse menu as shown below.
Confirm that the Plug-in Id column contains the tubame.portability plug-in name.

ns2:section.ns2:para: The following describes how to use the features of each tool.
This feature finds the code that has to be rewritten when porting to JBoss.

This feature allows you to edit a visual representation of the search results. Sometimes it may be necessary to individually check what search results need to be ported. Visual checks or inquiries are made regarding such results to determine whether they need to be ported. This process is completed when all items that need to be ported have been found.
Perform the following steps.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Delete items that need not be ported.
Calculate the total number of lines.
Display the number of hits or all items.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Finds and converts code that can be converted. The following file conversions can be made.

ns2:row.ns2:entry: EJB deployment descriptor file with a vendor extension
EJB deployment descriptor file with a JBoss extension

ns2:section.ns2:para: Perform the following steps.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Start up the project creation wizard.
Use the New Java Project wizard to make the appropriate settings required by the environment of the item to be ported to create a project.
Position the source files that need to be ported.

Position the source files that need to be ported in the created project.
Position not only *.java, but also *.jar, *.xml, *.jsp, *.properties, *.xsd and all other files that are required for running the application.
There is no need to make all the preparations required for a successful build.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Perform the following steps.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Right-click a resource you want to search and select the following menu.

Make the following entries.
Knowledge XML file selection: Specify the Knowledge XML file to be searched.
Destination of output results: Specify a jbm file to which to save the search results
Click Finish to start the search.

ns2:section.ns2:para: The following describes a method for confirming search results.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Double click the saved jbm file that contains the search results.

ns2:note.ns2:para: This step is not necessary since the search result file automatically opens after a search has been conducted.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Check the screen for editing search results.

The screen for editing search results shows a list of items that may have to be ported. An overview of the displayed items is provided below. Double click a line to open an editor with an associated extension to display the relevant file.

ns2:note.ns2:para: The Switch display button in the Eclipse toolbar allows you to switch between display of all search items and hit items.

ns2:table.ns2:title: Items displayed in the screen for editing search results

ns2:row.ns2:entry: The number of items that matched the search conditions.
Path from project route of the relevant file.
Line number of the relevant file.

Difficulty icons indicate the degree of difficulty that porting involves.
There are the following classifications.
High
Requires major rewriting of the implementation involving major changes to the implementation, settings and other changes.
Middle
Requires minor rewriting of the implementation.
Low
Can be handled by minor rewriting that does not affect implementation.
Unknown
Unknown difficulty
NOT_TRN
Cannot be ported.

The number of the chapter in the Portability Examination Guideline.
Click an item to link to the Portability Examination Guideline.
To use this feature, the HTML created using the Knowledge Manager must be placed in the resources/guide/index.html.
The GUIDE_FILE_PATH parameter of the resources/properties/application*.properties
can be used to change the location.
Describes the details of a visual check (indicated by 0 column width when initially displayed).
Describes the details of an inquiry check (indicated by 0 column width when initially displayed).

Current status of visual check.
There are the following classifications.
Blank
There is no need for a visual check.
Not completed
There are still items that require visual checking.
Not checked
The visual check has not been conducted.
Completed
The visual check has been completed.
Checked (no need for porting)
The visual check has been completed (the check determined that there were no issues).
Checked (need to be ported)
The visual check has been completed (the check determined that porting was required).

Current status of inquiry check
There are the following classifications.
Blank
There is no need for an inquiry check.
Not completed
There are still items that require inquiry checking.
Not checked
The inquiry check has not been conducted.
Completed
The inquiry check has been completed.
Checked (no need for porting)
The inquiry check has been completed (the check determined that there were no issues).
Checked (need to be ported)
The inquiry check has been completed (the check determined that porting is necessary).

The approximate number of lines that must be rewritten.
There are the following classifications.
Numeric value
The approximate number of lines that must be rewritten.
TODO: Code manually calculated by SE
Items that should be calculated separately according to the commentary.
Unknown
Items that require separate calculation because the number of lines are not known.
Checked (no need for porting)
The inquiry check has been completed (the check determined that there were no issues).
Checked (need to be ported)
The inquiry check has been completed (the check determined that porting is necessary).
Provides a reason for why the stated number of lines need to be ported.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: The Checklist Information view allows you to check detailed information regarding items selected in the screen for editing search results. It allows you to check the following information.

ns2:table.ns2:title: Items that Checklist Information view displays.

ns2:row.ns2:entry: Investigation method or criteria relying on visual checks when a search is not enough to identify items that need to be migrated.
Inquiries made to the developer when the need for migration cannot be determined otherwise.
Describes the method used for searching items that need to be ported.
The reasons that make migration necessary.
The details of difficulties involved in performing migration work.
Reason given for not calculating the number of lines that need to be rewritten.
Investigation method used to calculate the number of lines that need to be rewritten.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: The Work Status view allows you to check current edit work status.

ns2:table.ns2:title: Items displayed in Work Status view

ns2:row.ns2:entry:
Displays current work status.
There are the following classifications.
The check item work has been completed.
Check visual check and inquiry check items.
Unknown/TODO: Check code manually calculated by SE.
Overwrite the file.
Indicates the remaining and total number of items in the visual check status and inquiry check status displayed in the screen for editing search results.
Unknown/TODO: Rewriting status of code manually calculated by SE
Indicates the remaining and total number of items in the rewriting status of unknown items and rewriting status of code manually calculated by SE displayed in the screen for editing search results.

ns2:section.ns2:para: To calculate the scale of porting required, the need for porting among all the search results must be determined. Steps for doing that are described below.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Items whose visual status has not been checked must be visually checked to determine whether or not they require porting. Check the relevant files to determine whether porting is required. When it becomes clear that porting is necessary, use the result to change the status of the visual status column. Right-click the relevant code to change the status to any of those listed below.

ns2:note.ns2:para: Use the Shift and Ctrl keys to select multiple items. (Note that the above menu will not appear when lines not subject to visual checks are included in the selection range.)

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: It is necessary to make inquiries to the developer regarding items whose inquiry status has not been checked to determine whether they require porting. Contact the developer to check whether or not the relevant code requires porting. When it becomes clear that porting is necessary, use the result to change the status of the inquiry status column. Right-click the relevant code to change the status to any of those listed below.

ns2:note.ns2:para: Use the Shift and Ctrl keys to select multiple items. (Note that the above menu will not appear when lines not subject to visual checks are included in the selection range.)

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Delete items that need not be ported.
This feature allows you to delete items not related to porting from the screen. You can either select single lines to delete them one at a time or select all lines to delete them at one time.

ns2:row.ns2:entry: Click the Delete Line button in the Eclipse toolbar to delete the selected line.
Click the Delete items need not be ported button in the Eclipse toolbar.

ns2:note.ns2:para: Use the Shift and Ctrl keys to select multiple items.

ns2:section.ns2:para: You can create totals and final reports by exporting edited results as a CSV file.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Select Export to CSV from the Eclipse menu to output a CSV file.
This tool does not provide a tool for analyzing CSV files. The user should create an analyzing tool or some other suitable tool.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Perform the following steps.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Start up the project creation wizard.
Use the New Java Project wizard to make the appropriate settings required by the environment of the item to be ported to create a project.
Position the source files that need to be ported.

Position the source files that need to be ported in the created project.
Position not only *.java, but also *.jar, *.xml, *.jsp, *.properties, *.xsd and all other files that are required for running the application.
There is no need to make all the preparations required for a successful build.

ns2:section.ns2:para: Perform the following steps.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: Select the resource you want to convert.
Right-click a resource you want to convert and select the following menu.

Make the following entries.
Destination of converted source file: Specify the location the converted source file will be saved to.
WebLogic version: Select the WebLogic Version of files that will be ported.
Click Finish to start the search of files that need to be converted and any resources that need to be converted will be converted.

ns2:section.ns2:para:
Delete the installed tubame.portability_*. This completes the uninstallation.
The * part of the name varies with the version.
Add the -clean option when starting up Eclipse after deletion.
The following describes an installation procedure of Python and lxml module.
The following describes an installation procedure using yum on Linux.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para:
execute rpm command and confirm whether Python and lxml module are installed. When it is not installed, install it.
$ rpm –q python python-lxml python-* python-lxml-*

execute yum command and install Python and lxml module.
$ su - # yum install python python-lxml

ns2:section.ns2:para: The following describes an installation procedure using installer on Windows.

ns2:listitem.ns2:para: download an installer from the following links.
run the installer "python-2.7.6.*.msi" and Follow the wizard instructions to install.
run the installer "lxml-3.2.4.*-py2.7.exe" and Follow the wizard instructions to install.
